message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. I believe it's a game-changer and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1100000. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your offer but $1100000 is a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $850000 for this product.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

I understand that $850000 is a bit below my target, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you the product for $950000. This is the best I can do, but I think it's still a great deal for you. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $950000 is still a bit high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $900000.  Let's see if we can close this deal.

I'm getting close to my minimum, but I still need to make a profit. I can offer you the product for $925000. This is my final offer, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle one more time. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your final offer, but  $925000 is still a bit higher than I can go. I'm willing to pay $900000, which is closer to my budget and a fair compromise for both of us. If this isn't acceptable, I'll have to move on to another seller.

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $925000. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a one-year warranty and a free consultation to help you get the most out of the product. This is my final offer. What do you think?
